elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: Frage1
elements.title: Switzerland has always been primarily a country of immigration.

elements.name: Frage2
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.
elements.correctAnswer: Switzerland was a typical country of emigration between 1850 and 1914.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Switzerland also owed its economic upswing during industrialization to foreign workers, who made up 15% of the population at the time.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: As Switzerland developed into one of the richest countries, politicians discussed compulsory naturalization to ensure that foreign workers could remain in the country. This idea was supported by a broad section of the population.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.
elements.correctAnswer: Fear of foreign infiltration and the disintegration of traditional values grew in parts of the population.

elements.name: panel4
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: The writer Max Frisch was referring to the refugees that Switzerland took in during the Second World War with his statement "They called for workers and people came".

elements.name: question9
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.
elements.correctAnswer: Max Frisch was referring to the Italian seasonal workers who were only tolerated as laborers in Switzerland after the Second World War.

elements.name: panel5
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: The free movement of persons led to an unexpectedly high increase in immigration and thus facilitated the acceptance of the mass immigration initiative.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.

elements.name: panel6
elements.title: Judge whether the statement is correct or incorrect.

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Since the refugee crisis in 2015, net immigration in Switzerland increased by 40% until 2019.

elements.name: question15
elements.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.
elements.correctAnswer: Between 2014 and 2019, net immigration in Switzerland fell by 40 percent.

pages.name: Richtig oder falsch?7
pages.title: If you have marked "incorrect", please correct the statement.

elements.name: question17
elements.title: The fifth Switzerland refers to the 10% of Swiss nationals who live abroad.
